answers.answer: I would advise you to seek out a good endocrinologist who specializes in thyroids (many only deal with Diabetes).  Thyroid conditions are very treatable and, once labs are brought into range, don't stop most people from having a family.The thyroid replacement hormone (Synthroid or other equivalent) is a medication most of us have to take for life but there are many, many thyroid patients who have had beautiful families while on thyroid replacement hormones.  My niece is one of those beautiful Synthroid babies!

I agree with utahmomma.It is best to get the TSH lower- nearer a 1- before you begin a family. The TSH is suggestive of hypothyroidism. I would suggest a repeat TSH to insure that it isn't a transient finding.Then get to an endo for treatment. Some symptoms of hypo are fatigue, mood issues, sleep trouble, memory problems and many more. Hypothyroidism can also put you at risk for heart disease. That's not to scare you. If you get treatment, you should do fine.
